Fast paced arena game where you hurl disks at your oponents to knock them out while traversing the arena by jumping from platform to platform. Richochet is also one of those classic games that still has a small dedicated community playing it after all these years. Random servers may only have a few people in them at any given time but if you find a community that still plays Ricochet, it is a nice way to kill time and have some great fun.

It's been a very inspiring indoor sports game - survival frisbee, if you will. When I played, there were only two people in the server so it was a very mundane match but It was still enjoyable. If I want to play frisbee in computer, I think with a little help of some gambling could make this game more fun.

 +) Simple rules. Direct and forward.

 -) This game is too old and unpopular so there are mostly no one in the server.
 -) There are no BGM. Not even at the menu. This could make things very boring.
Pretty bad controls, Bad graphics, small maps, sometimes 1 player enters rest of the time it's just bots,.... Perhaps if you want some nostalgia but even then there are way better games to buy.

Es un juego excelente que puedes obtener a un precio ridiculamente bajo -revisa "Counter-Strike 1 : Anthology". Lamentablemente no estuve en sus días de "fama" y apenas pude jugar un par de partidas con gente... real.

El juego en sí es bastante rápido, sin descanso, constante, dinámico, un descuido y estás muerto. Básicamente.

PROS :
-Buena jugabilidad (Practicamente la misma de Counter Strike, Half Life, Team Fortress Classic, Day of Defeat...)
-Bastante entretenido de jugar
-Gráficos simples y para su época, geniales (no ha envejecido bien en todo caso)

CONTRAS:
-El juego está prácticamente muerto, literalmente no hay NADIE jugando.

Conclusión : Si no es por Counter Strike Anthology, no hay razón para obtener este juego.

Despite its simplicity, this game is quite fun. It's fun to bounce off of... bouncy bits and throw disc... things against... bumper things to knock that one prick off the stage. I only have a few real gripes with this:

-It can be difficult to find a server to play on
-The aforementioned bouncy bits have varying degrees of bouncyness, without any indication of what that bouncyness is. This means that there will be times when you expect to fly way over yonder when you only go down a floor.
-The additionally aforementioned disc things are effectively two dimensional, so you can't shoot at someone a floor above you, and vice versa. The bumper things are also very picky where you shoot them, so if you shoot your disc as soon as you go off the bumper, it's heading off to the vastness of space.

I found the power-up system to be enjoyable, but confusing to new players. To save you the trouble of figuring it out, I've prepared a little guide.

Note: You can have multiple power-ups and once.

-Power: Red Thingy: Decapitates people when you shoot them
-Fast Shot: Green Thingy: Lets you fire a flurry of discs at your opponent
-Triple Shot: Purple Thingy: Let's you fire three shots at once in three different directions. Useful for ricochet kills.
-Ice Shot: White Thingy: Turns victim into effective turtle on hit. Also seems to have slight homing properties from my experience.

5/6 Would play regularly

[h1]Ricochet, one of the best games on steam.[/h1]

[b] Before I go any further I would just like to say there is a tl;dr at the bottom of this review[/b]

So I'd like to start by saying that I love this game, and its core gameplay is good enough to look past its few flaws. This game is a mod of the original half-life that came out in 2000, however because of its thriving community and plethora of mods, its age has only really now begun to show. It places you in a future alternate universe where the entirety of existence depends on your ability to partake in the activity of “Duel to the Death Space Frisbee” or DDSF for short. Below I've made a table to outline all the various elements of the game with a rating at the end.   
[table]
    [tr]
        [th][b]Concept[/b][/th]
        [th][b]Description[/b][/th]
        [th][b]Rating out of 10[/b][/th]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Story[/td]
        [td]The story of Ricochet is a deep and complex one. You are placed in a totally new world, where it only seems as if people are interested in this sport "Space Frisbee". You are never told anything about your character, except that they are a Space Frisbee player. That being said though, your character is made to be disposable, and when your character dies, it's over. You are placed in the shoes of a new person, who wears the same clothing as you, and sounds the same as you, and often shares the same fate as you. It's a highly critical commentary on today’s culture, where it seems as if people are losing their lives to something arbitrary, almost a sport, for no real distinguishable reason. It makes the player contemplate what they are doing with their lives, and whether it is meaningful or not. I won't spoil the rest of the story for you, but all I can say is that you should look forward to epic conspiracies, insane bosses, and one of the most exciting and fulfilling endings in all of video games.[/td]
        [td]10[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Gameplay[/td]
        [td]Now, Ricochet is truly one of this games that you can describe as "easy to learn, difficult to master". Its gameplay seems simple at first, as it begins with "throw disc and hit object" but as you progress you find more ways to play the game using its initial mechanics. First you're introduced with obstacles that your discs bounce off of, allowing you to start having your discs ricochet. The obstacles then change in complexity and usefulness, as near the later parts of the game, you even start to avoid them as they can be very deadly. There are different power-ups for your discs that change the way you use them, which gives a greater feeling of accomplishment when you figure out how to use one of the power-ups to its fullest affect. Ricochet’s gameplay respects player intelligence by giving you many different ways to play. The depth of the mechanics have been compared to dwarf fortress, and although I wouldn't go that far I can certainly see players sinking thousands of hours into this game trying to really figure everything out for themselves.[/td]
        [td]10[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Graphics[/td]
        [td]There isn't too much to say here. For a game that came out 14 (now nearly 15) years ago, it looks quite good. When in came out it was among the best looking games to date, and remained that way until about 2005. Despite looking a bit aged its color and stylistic focus make it easy and pleasant on the eyes, while still allowing for good atmosphere.[/td]
        [td]8[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Multiplayer[/td]
        [td]I'll just start out by say the multiplayer is AMAZING. It captures the cinematic and atmospheric feel of the single player, while allowing player interaction in a diverse open world. You're allowed to find various "Arenas" in which you may do battle with your friends to see who's the best at DDSF. With a booming community, and an incredible amount of modded servers you can easily find yourself playing this multiplayer for hours on end. Even though it's been 14 years, because of its very in-depth gameplay and large community, the Ricochet multiplayer is still one of the best you can find on this platform.[/td]
        [td]10[/td]
    [/tr]
[/table]

All in all, I'd give this game a 10/10. Everything about it is amazing and enjoyable, from its single player, multi-player, stunning visuals, in-depth gameplay, and did I mention its kickin' soundtrack? Well it's amazing. Seriously, if you don't have this game, you need to fix that right now.

TL;DR In my opinion one of the best games valve has ever made, I highly recommend this game.

[b]Ricochet é um jogo do ano 2000 com o estilo de um jogo da década de 80.[/b]

Uma pena que estamos no final de 2014 e esse estilo de jogo está completamente defasado, se fosse um jogo feito para plataformas móveis (smartphones, tablets) até seria aceitável para passar o tempo.

[list]
    [*]Cenários repetitivos, mudando apenas o layout das plataformas;
    [*]Pouca variedade na jogabilidade (alguns powerups e modos de jogo que mudam pouca coisa na experiência do game);
    [*]Pouquíssimos jogadores, servidores ficam vazios a maior parte do tempo.
[/list]

Se você quiser testá-lo com os amigos, até pode ser divertido por algumas horas, mas enjoa muito rapidamente e não justifica a compra. Felizmente o jogo veio de graça para mim num pacote de jogos do Half-Life.

Yet again Valve Software brings us another timeless classic! Ricochet is a masterpiece that takes you on a journy between platforms both literally and figurativley. The way the frisbees are thrown and jumps are made are very symbolic of our everyday struggles. Throwing a fisbee represents our struggles in hitting our goals while the jumping represents our advances through our stages of life. Never before have I seen a game that has struck me this deep.

[b]PROS:[/b]
+ cool gameplay
+ many mods

[b]CONS:[/b]
- not that many active players

[b]Comment:[/b]
This game has a similar issue as other old Valve multiplayer games, the days when this game had many players are gone. Today the community of active players is small and there are not a lot of games to join (I just found a couple of servers with 2 people each). I got this game for free with Counter Strike 1.6 and decided to give it a go. It's a Tron type game with the matching visuals. The gameplay is about disk throwing and pushing your opponents off the platforms. Which is great but lack of people to actually play with pulls down the score a little bit. However even dueling one person is good fun so I recommend it.
------------------------------------------------------------------
